Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of citizenship judge's assessment of residency compliance

Crimes.Legal_Rule: Applicants must prove physical presence in Canada for 1095 days

Crimes.Applicable_Process: Citizenship application with post-denial judicial review
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Physical presence requirement of 1095 days in four years

Crimes.Regulation_Cited: Citizenship Regulations related to residency and honesty
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied by Federal Court
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Discrepancies in travel records not probed
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Duty to provide complete and accurate information
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Citizenship denied due to credibility concerns

Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Relevant sections of Citizenship Act on misrepresentation

Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Judge failed to ensure fair and transparent process
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Not applicable – omission rather than forged documents
